description: I am a versatile and driven Computer Science professional based in Chicago, IL, with a strong passion for software engineering and problem-solving. I am on track to graduate in May 2025 with a B.S. in Computer Science from the University of Illinois at Chicago, where I maintain a 3.70 GPA. Before transferring, I studied at Michigan State University, earning a 3.83 GPA.

With expertise in multiple programming languages, software development frameworks, and game development technologies, I am always eager to expand my skill set and explore new areas of technology, including deep learning, financial systems, and large-scale software architecture. My experience spans research, freelancing, game development, and industry-level projects, giving me a strong foundation in adapting to new challenges and delivering effective solutions.

One of my most rewarding experiences was working as a Junior Associate Software Engineer at NetherRealm Studios, where I contributed to the development of *Mortal Kombat 1*. Seeing my name in the gameâ€™s credits was a defining moment that highlighted the dedication, collaboration, and problem-solving required to bring such a large-scale project to life. This experience reinforced my passion for software engineering and my commitment to building high-performance, impactful systems.

I thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments where I can apply my technical expertise, solve real-world challenges, and continue learning. My curiosity, adaptability, and drive to push the boundaries of innovation fuel my passion for software development. I am excited to bring my skills, problem-solving abilities, and enthusiasm to a team that values creativity, excellence, and technological growth.

employment.title: Research Software Engineer
employment.hours: Part-time (10 to 20 hours weekly) alongside school.
description: Collaborated across interdisciplinary teams, including healthcare, engineering, and design in the University of Illinois at Chicago Wearable Technology and Sensory Enhancement Laboratory.
Worked as a full-stack software engineer, utilizing C, Python, JavaScript, and HTML to build functional prototypes and research tools designed around accessibility and connectivity.
Designed and developed a wearable solution to diagnose and rehabilitate the impeded communication of stroke patients using an oral embedded device with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) connectivity.

employment.title: Freelance Software Developer
employment.hours: Part-time (20 to 30 hours weekly) alongside school.
description: Collaborated with clients, artists, and developers while leading full-stack iOS development of two internal tools using Swift, UIKit, SpriteKit, and SceneKit.
Developed a private RESTful API in Node.js connected to an SQL database.
Created internal data manipulation tools in Python using SQLite3.

employment.title: Junior Associate Software Engineer
employment.hours: Full-time (30 to 40 hours weekly) alongside school.
description: Worked on *Mortal Kombat 1* at a Warner Bros. Games subsidiary.
Designed new features, debugged systems, and worked alongside industry professionals on a massive C++ codebase in Unreal Engine 4 using JIRA and Perforce to stay organized.
Participated in Scrum-based Agile development, attending daily stand-ups, sprint planning meetings, and code reviews to ensure smooth feature development and timely bug fixes.

employment.title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Lead developer on a Unity-based spaying simulation for veterinary students, working with designers, artists, and experts at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign College of Veterinary Medicine in partnership with the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign Health Care Engineering Systems Center.

description: Installed and configured software, routed and terminated ethernet cables, and set up security system.
